Reporting to the Casino Shift Manager, under the supervision of the Live Games Supervisor, this position ensures that Casino guests have an exceptional entertainment experience by running Blackjack and other house games.   • Combination of relevant education, training and/or experience.

Experience

  • Experience providing customer service.

  • Previous experience explaining and dealing table games to guests would be preferred.

title: Heavy Duty Large Engine Rebuild Mechanic
description:
Are you a Heavy Duty Mechanic who specializes in engine rebuilds for mining class equipment? Then we want to hear from you! Union Tractor Ltd. is the largest non-O.E.M. heavy equipment parts and service dealer in Western Canada. They are seeking an Engine Rebuild Mechanic complete overhauls and rebuilds on primarily Mining Class Caterpillar and Cummings large horse power diesel engines and components at their Nisku, AB location. With no field work, this is a great opportunity to work in a clean, new, state-of-the-art shop. And with no shift work, you can be home most nights!
Nisku, AB is one of the largest Industrial/Business Parks in Canada, and is home to thousands of employees and hundreds of businesses. Nisku is located on the outskirts of Edmonton, the Provinces Capital City. Nisku is situated on highway 2 north which is the major logistics artery through Alberta. Currently there is no bussing or mass transit service from Edmonton to Nisku so your own transportation arrangements will be necessary.
PLEASE NOTE: This is a full time, permanent position. If you live in the surrounding areas or would consider relocating to Nisku, we look forward to hearing from you. Relocation assistance may be provided for the right candidate. Union Tractor is located at 3750 13 St, Nisku, AB T9E 1C6, Canada
SALARY & BENEFITS:

  • $45.43 per hour
  • Comprehensive benefits package including health care, vision, prescriptions, pension and dental
  • Year round work, overtime hours available if required

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:

  • Licensed Red Seal Journeyman Heavy Equipment Technician (off Road) Equipment Technician
  • Must have a valid class 5 driver’s license.

Experience:

  • Minimum 3 years of engine rebuild experience required, 5 years preferred.
  • Preferred extensive engine rebuild experience on large CAT Series of engines such and 3400, 3500, and C models.
  • Experience on Cummins QSK60 and other large engines
  • Knowledge or experience with mechanical fuel systems.
  • Must be able to read dial bore gauges, micrometers, and other measuring equipment.
  • Off-Road heavy Equipment experience required.
  • Experience with Caterpillar SIS and ET as well as Cummins quick serve

Skills and Abilities:

  • Dedication to safety and ability to follow applicable safety policies.
  • Ability to communicate verbally and in writing in English.
  • Willing to learn and take direction.
  • Must be able to work under pressure in some situations.
  • Work overtime if required.

Working conditions:

  • Drug test required

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:

  • Overhaul, recondition, repair and or replace mining class engines and components
  • Apply proper technical skills in inspection, failure analysis, assembly, diagnosis, and operating performance tests
  • Documents paperwork for all equipment repairs.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Union Tractor, however only qualified candidates will be contacted for this position.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45.43 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • mechanical: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Trade Certificate (preferred)

title: Become a Poker Dealer / Devenir un croupier de poker
description:
Since its opening in 2010, Playground has experienced immense popularity with local and international players alike. Playground is conveniently located just minutes south of downtown Montreal in the Mohawk territory of Kahnawake. The Playground Complex is currently excited to reopen its poker tables (respecting COVID-capacity rules), while also offering a selection of over 600 Electronic Gaming Devices (slots). In addition, Playground includes an inviting and locally renowned restaurant The Rail Coal Fire Bistro.

Playground is rapidly expanding and is currently seeking an experienced, Poker Dealer to join our dynamic team.

Schedule: Variable - Days, Evenings, Nights, Weekends

We are looking for dynamic and energetic individuals with a "passion for poker". Previous experience is a must either as a player or a dealer. This job entails being a team player and comfortable working in a fast paced environment.

Poker Dealer School - How it works:

Our dealers are among the best in the world and we pride ourselves on the quality of the game we provide to our players. In order to maintain this high level throughout our team members, several steps will follow your application to this position.

  • You will be sent a quiz by email that must be completed. To qualify for step #2 you must score above 70% and take no more than 20 minutes to complete the quiz.
  • Those who qualify will then be scheduled for table tests. A table test includes hand recognition testing, chip counting (stack/piles, all-ins, and pots), math percentage questions, pitch, shuffle and chip cutting testing.
  • Those who succeed in step #2 will then have a background check processed.
  • Once the background check has been approved, all candidates are initiated through a 4 week paid training course before hitting our floor. The training will run from 9:00am to 5:00pm each day. The training is paid at a rate of $13.50 an hour.

Requirements:

  • Must be bilingual (English and French) and 18 years or older.
  • Must be able to work seated for long periods of time and do repetitive upper body movement.
  • Flexibility to work various shifts, including weekends, evenings and holidays essential.
  • Previous experience in a similar environment is an asset but not required.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:

Ensure the efficient, effective and productive management of the physical plant facilities and operating staff for the Mississauga commercial portfolio.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Capital Project Work
 
  • Oversee tenant improvement work and obtain proposals and pricing for work
  • Review all work permits daily to ensure awareness of all contractor work occurring in the building.
  • Review and monitor building functions and provide direction to staff and trades
  • Collaborate with the Property Manager in completing capital projects on time and on budget
  • Be an active participant in possible unbudgeted and/or emergency-related projects, as needed

People Leadership
 
  • Supervise and manage building staff (scheduling, performance management, career development, etc.)
  • Ensure daily inspections of mechanical and electrical service areas
  • Supervise maintenance management system operations
  • Implement and supervise procedures for the maintenance, operation, and repairs of buildings and equipment

Budgeting and Reporting
 
  • Prepare departmental budgets
  • Partner with management to prepare annual operating and capital budgets for a variety of properties
  • Prepare monthly variance, property, and activity reports

Building Management
 
  • Maintain site specific WHMIS, and health and safety programs
  • Daily review of all completed service requests to ensure SLAs consistently met and delivered
  • Oversight of the OneServe (Angus) system
  • Manage sustainability opportunities with the operations team and consultants
  • Enhance customer service with tenants
  • Collaborate with management to ensure property is compliant with the Entuitive (risk compliance) program
  • Advise and update team with policy and procedure updates
  • Complete insurance claims and internal quarterly reports

QUALIFICATIONS
 
  • 5+ years of commercial building operations experience
  • Post-secondary education in Engineering, Building Sciences and/or Trades training
  • BES 1 and 2, a minimum requirement
  • Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills able to interact confidently with various internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong leadership and communication skills
  • Experience completing reports and budgets focused on decreasing repair costs and increasing energy management initiatives.

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR - Full time 

SHORELINES SLOTS AT KAWARTHA DOWNS

KAW-OPS-002-2022

 

Team up with the industry’s best and provide great guest experiences at Shorelines Slots at Kawartha Downs!

This position is responsible for assisting, as required, with the planning and directing of site operations within the scope of Cage, Slots and Guest Services along with the overall leadership of these departments under the general supervision of the Manager, Operations. Their primary role is to provide authorization and immediate leadership to staff operating in Cage, Slots and Guest Services roles on a shift to shift basis. Supervisor, Operations ensures adherence to all policies and procedures; identifies implements and recommends improvements to increase operational effectiveness and compliance to enhance the guest experience and provides a safe work environment for all team members. Supervisor, Operations ensures compliance of designated departments with policy and procedure, legislation, health and safety, and other statutory regulations and programs including the AGCO.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Helps create an engaged work environment by choosing positivity and fun, recognizing excellent performance and by caring about and supporting our team members every day;
  • Responsible for overseeing the Cage, Slots and Guest Services department and any applicable sign offs within this scope, during their shift
  • Provides leadership, direction, mentoring and performance management to the Cage, Slots and Guest Services departments or as assigned in the absence of an Operations Manager, while providing continuous coaching for success to achieve high performance
  • Assists in the implementation of the departmental strategic plans
  • Assists with de-escalating and addressing guest concerns.
  • Monitors and analyzes team member productivity, work skills and behaviours
  • Develops and cultivates strong working relationships with all stakeholders: guests, management, team members and Regulators
  • Liaises and communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Reporting irregularities and suspicious activities - financial or otherwise; reviewing and preparing incident reports
  • Ensures compliance of designated departments with policy and procedure, legislation, health and safety and other statutory regulations and programs including the AGCO
  • Anticipates operational and service issues before they escalate, trouble-shoots and resolves guest concerns before they become complaints
  • Administers the Collective Agreement and grievance discussions (where applicable)
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed

Education and Qualification Requirements

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in gaming/ casino management;
  • Experience working in various departments within gaming an asset
  • Post-Secondary education in Business or Operations Management or suitable combination of education and experience.
  • Proven leadership skills and the ability to train and develop team members.
  • Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service oriented communication.
  • A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development.
  • Computer proficiency in MS Office
  • The ability to obtain and maintain registration as a Category 1 Gaming Assistant with AGCO

Since the fun never stops at Shorelines, candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights, based on business needs.

title: Supervisor, Operations
description:
Location



Royal Bank Building - 335 - 8th Avenue SW



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




DESCRIPTION & RESPONSIBILITIES


DESCRIPTION:


Reporting to the Manager, Operations, your primary responsibilities will be supervision of the building’s daily operations and maintenance, ensuring compliance with all safety legislation as well as company policies and processes. You will be required to ensure that day-to-day HVAC and preventative maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment is operating at optimum levels. You will also be responsible for supervising all operations and maintenance staff ensuring a high level of communication and teamwork within the team, as well as with other departments.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

+ Inspecting, supervising, and coordinating the repair and maintenance of any building mechanical, electrical, life safety and envelope systems.

+ Liaising with tenants regarding any requests for services or information, ensuring issues and concerns are resolved to the tenant’s satisfaction.

+ Organizing and overseeing mechanical and electrical contractors performing base building and tenant improvement work.

+ Ensuring all systems are operating in an efficient safe manner and that related safety guidelines set out in provincial Environmental Health and Safety legislation, and company policies/procedures are being met.

+ Providing guidance, coaching and direction to operations and maintenance staff on a day-to-day basis, giving regular feedback.

+ Preparing Operations and Maintenance staff performance reviews in Workday.

+ Completing checks of and making any required corrections to Tenant Billing System for each version and submitting to Shared Services by the 15th of each month.

+ Working within Budget constraints, assisting in annual budget planning and preparation".

+ Other duties and projects as assigned.

+ Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health, and Environment Policy.

+ Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.

+ Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.

+ Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviors are unsafe.

+ Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviors to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.

+ Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.

+ Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required








SERVICE / PERSONAL SKILLS:


This individual requires superior customer service skills, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to deal with difficult situations diplomatically. This successful candidate must have a thorough understanding of operational and technical issues to provide direction and leadership to the Operations and Maintenance departments and efficiently interact with Construction, Security, Tenant Services, and Building Services. The position demands flexibility and a high degree of organizational and administrative skills to manage a variety of priorities and changing deadlines.


EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

+ A minimum of five (5) years’ experience working in a large commercial multi-tenant building.

+ Supervisory experience in a similar capacity leading large team.

+ Project management experience.

+ Proven customer service skills.

+ Intermediate computer skills in MS Word and Excel.

+ Experience with Office365.

+ Ability to learn new software and technology

+ Thorough knowledge of building components, including air handling systems, mechanical & electrical systems, water treatment, environmental issues and building automation systems.






EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:

+ Fourth Class Power Engineering Certification is required.

+ Trade certificate would be an asset

+ Completion of leadership/supervisory/management training







We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: Operations Supervisor

The Operations Supervisors are responsible for Cando's day to day and shift by shift operations while ensuring customer commitments are met safely and on time.

Roles and Responsibilities

Safety

  • Actively participates in the execution of Cando's Safety Management Plan and Initiatives including audits and reports; observes, documents, and evaluates safe work practices as per rules and regulations
  • Facilitates employee meetings to emphasize safety and discuss safety risks; participates on customer safety and quality teams as required
  • Investigates accidents and incidents, determines root cause

Service Delivery

  • Ensures employees are providing superior service in keeping with Cando's Vision, Mission and Values
  • Supports daily and weekly operating plans and customer interaction for the team ensuring customer needs are being met
  • Performs regular audits and confirms that all preventative and scheduled maintenance and inspections are completed as required to ensure the facility and equipment remains in prime operating conditions at all times

Management and Administration

  • Assists in managing monthly budgets, service plans, personnel development plans, timekeeping and resource requirements
  • Manages the customer and contract owner business relationship
  • Assists in establishing and maintaining the operating team including participation in hiring, coaching, leading activities, monitoring payroll and WCB functions
  • Maintains standard operating procedures, operating the site safely and meeting all regulatory requirements

Leadership & Employee Development

  • Influences and inspires others to achieve company objectives
  • Builds and maintains positive relationships with peers, customers and other third parties
  • Leads others in adapting to innovative work environments and ensures company initiatives, decisions, and policies are communicated
  • Provides for the delivery of training and developmental requirements related to the department through employee coaching and mentoring
  • Provides direct supervision, conducts proactive proficiency observations, and daily records of operations
  • Trains team members and provides operational assistance and expertise when required

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities

  • Communicates effectively both orally and in writing with people of all backgrounds and levels of comprehension including managers, employees, customers, and the public
  • Demonstrates initiative to work with others to foster a respectful workplace; creates a work environment that is open to maintaining positive relationships; empowers individuals and teams to set and accomplish goals
  • Understands effective cost monitoring, control, reporting, and bottom-line profitability and accountability
  • Ability to exercise discretion and good judgement in providing information to internal or external customers in a courteous and tactful manner with regard to sensitive or confidential issues
  • Ability to handle a diverse range of responsibilities in an entrepreneurial environment
  • Proficient in the use of computer equipment, operating systems, word processing, spreadsheets and database software
  • Ability to obtain and maintain all necessary certification and meet all safety and customer requirements including clear drug and alcohol testing; hold and maintain a valid provincial driver's license

Education and Experience

  • Minimum five (5) years' working in heavy industrial environment; rail experience is an asset including current or past operating rules qualifications
  • Minimum two (2) years in a leadership or supervisory position. Rail Supervision experience is an asset
  • Experience working with Safety Management Systems

description:
Waste Connections of Canada is looking for a full-time Operations/Route Supervisor. We are looking for a SAFETY inclined, energetic, independent thinker, and a proactive Servant Leader capable of making, and creating change using our 5 core values. Our Brampton - Peel District, has an immediate opening for an Operations/Route Supervisor to lead a team of Residential Drivers within an overall group of 4 Supervisors. The Operations/Route Supervisor will have approx. 15 - 20 Driver/Loaders under their direct supervision, and will oversee 15 - 18 routes in the Peel Residential collection contract. The Supervisor will also assist the Operations Manager with daily route scheduling.




Previous experience managing a group of Drivers is required.




Position Summary:


Operations/Route Supervisor is responsible for managing the Residential Drivers within their assigned line of business. The Operations/Route Supervisor ensures that Residential Collections operations are running safely by performing driver observations and monthly safety meetings. This is a leadership role in our collections unit. The key responsibilities will be to ensure that our #1 value – safety, will be your focus at all times; also that Waste Connections is meeting, or exceeding the requirements of the collection contract.




Duties and Responsibilities:



+ Ensures that Drivers completing daily collections safety.


+ Assists Maintenance staff on truck issues from drivers, and checks on VCR’s when requested.


+ Plans and monitors employee schedules and route scheduling including regular communication throughout the day until all routes are completed.


+ Assists other Supervisors with collection issues on other LOBs.


+ Performance Management of employees through the progressive discipline process.


+ Conducts accident investigations including scene management, first accident report and assist with final analysis of the root cause and preventative measures. Maintaining adherence to company safety policies and MTO regulations.


+ Conducts field inspections and audits of all site personnel to ensure proper work procedures.


+ Works closely with Region Inspectors to ensure service issues or missed pickups are reported and resolved.


+ Additional requirements as requested by Operations or District Managers.





Qualifications:



+ Minimum 3 – 5 years managing Drivers in a unionized environment.


+ Knowledge of OSHA, MOL, and MOE guidelines.


+ Knowledge using Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.


+ Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.


+ Must be detail-oriented, highly accountable and able to prioritize tasks.


+ Minimum DZ Driver’s License.


+ ·Prior waste collection experience is an asset.





What’s In It for You?




You will be joining and serving in a team environment with colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. Our compensation package is competitive, and comes with excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, RRSP plans. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example, through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives and more.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
Company Description

We are SGS. The world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 89,000 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

Job Description

  • Our Company operates on a 24/7 basis. The position requires to work on rotating shifts ranging from 8 - 12 hours in length on a schedule of days, afternoons, nights and weekends. 
  • This position requires you to have a valid driver’s license along with a vehicle to transport samples. 

This position is expected to direct, plan, organize and motivate staff in the performance of their responsibilities and functions. Ensure Operational targets and customer expectation are met in timely and efficient manner, while observing corporate quality, environmental and health and safety requirements.

1.    Accountable for the delivery of data to achieve client satisfaction by maintaining production and specified turnaround targets.

  • Monitors production and ensures optimum staff levels/shifts to achieve standards for production, quality and financial performance.  Monitors throughput and performance.
  • Manages supplies to achieve optimum production and cost effectiveness.
  • Monitors and reports weekly production status. Maintains production targets and takes proactive measures to sustain these targets.
  • Provide authoritative opinions in their area of expertise and finds new and innovative ways of improving production efficiencies.
  • Works toward continuous improvement in production and efficiency, delivery of quality data promptly, adhering to predetermined schedules.
  • Responsible for managing production by providing client services and internal operations with scheduling of sample analysis and accurate information on completion dates to meet client satisfaction.
  • Review results for accuracy prior to release to customers

2.    Complies and ensures that all work follows Quality systems and that quality targets are maintained.

  • Accountable for ensuring that the quality of data, current methodologies and the execution of the methods are in compliance with the current accreditation under ISO 9001.
  • Accountable for familiarizing oneself with the Quality Manual and ensuring appropriate documentation is current and reliable.
  • Coordinate H&S activities assigned for the location
  • Visiting work sites to evaluate field staff for compliance to SOP’s and H&S regulations.
Qualifications

  • Education: Diploma in a related discipline or equivalent experience; preference in a science field
  • Experience: Over 3 years of previous experience in Agriculture or a related field.
  • Previous supervisory in a union environment an asset
  • Specific technical skills: 
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner. 
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.  
  • Detail orientated and has the ability to take accurate notes.
  • Candidates must be proficient in using various type of computer software (Word, Excel, etc.).
  • Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.
  • Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
  • Ability to work well with others & independently. 
  • Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.
  • Works well under pressure.
  • Extended hours may be required from time to time.
  • Possess and maintains a valid driver’s license.
  • Travel to other SGS locations may be required from time to time.
  • Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.


Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. 

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Founded in 2016, Clutch is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital, and Azure Capital Partners.

We have a deep passion for building and bringing teams together. We value individuality, diversity of thought and embrace a problem-solving culture.

About the role and opportunity:

As Clutch continues to scale, we're looking to bring on an Operations Supervisor - Mech as a critical member of our team. Working within the Vehicles Operations Group, the Operations Supervisor - Mech will own Clutch's mechanical production function and be responsible for the team's output quality and volume.

Your team's tasks include the inspection, repair, and safety certification of vehicles. Additionally, you will be responsible for the planning and execution of strategies that will allow this function to scale as Clutch's mechanical production requirements grow.

Being highly organized, having strong communication skills, and excellent attention to detail are all necessities due to the high volume of vehicles that are bought, reconditioned, and sold week to week!

What you'll do: 

  • Lead and motivate the production team
  • Build and maintain relationships with external vendors
  • Coordinate repairs and other work with external vendors  
  • Ensure plans for repairs are executed on time and that all issues are communicated and tracked
  • Enable Clutch to scale production volume while ensuring inspections and repairs meet Clutch's quality standards
  • Ensure production deficiencies are tracked and actioned, with a goal of continuously improving customer experience
  • Achieve daily, weekly and monthly mechanical production targets set by the General Manager
  • Lead process improvement initiatives and projects
  • Work with other teams to keep vehicle information up-to-date (communication is key)

We're looking for: 

  • Tech-savvy: you're comfortable in spreadsheets on Excel or G-Sheets
  • An interest in the automotive industry and feel comfortable troubleshooting basic vehicle issues
  • Experience in operations management, bonus points if this experience was in the automotive sector
  • People leadership experience or mentorship - you're a team player above all else
  • Entrepreneurial spirit with a get-it-done, bias-towards-action attitude 
  • High attention to detail while being able to multitask and manage competing priorities
  • Valid Driver's License (Clean Driver's Abstract)
  • Post-Secondary Education

Nice to have: 

  • Previous automotive experience
  • Previous experience working in a production environment and/or project management
  • Passion for automotive

Why you'll love it at Clutch: 

  • Autonomy & Ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
  • Competitive Compensation and Equity Incentives!
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget -- for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Health & Dental Benefits 

Clutch is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. If you require accommodation at any stage of the interview process, please email

talent@clutch.ca

.

title: Golden Skybridge, Operations Supervisor $25/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?

Supporting and leading the Operations Team, to ensure they provide safe and professional hospitality

What perks can you expect?

  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe 
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location 
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends 
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations 
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks 

What will you do in this job?

  • Assist in the day-to-day management of the Attraction team and ensure they provide upbeat and professional hospitality. Attraction team is responsible for Zipline, Challenge Course, Giant Swing, , mountain coaster, ticket validation, trail monitoring, interpretative programing and guiding
  • Responsible for supporting the daily work assignments (including meal breaks) of Adventure Guides
  • Training of new and existing Adventure Guides and provide ongoing coaching and feedback
  • Plan and facilitate emergency response drills and lead rescue procedures as needed
  • Create a positive and encouraging team environment and motivate team to deliver exceptional guest experience
  • Equipment inventory and upkeep
  • Responsible for opening and closing procedures, including conducting safety and maintenance inspections
  • Maintain high standards for employee appearance, customer service, safety and the environment
  • Upkeep and cleaning of work zone to ensure all areas meet expectations for cleanliness
  • Serve as the escalation point for customer service issues and handle customer concerns by reacting quickly and professionally
  • Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with H&S and our Always Honest Policy
  • Perform the duties of an Adventure Guide as required

What skills and experience do you need for this job?

  • A minimum of one-year supervisory experience with proven ability to manage a team
  • Strong physical stamina and conditioning. Physical demands of the position include: working outdoors in all weather conditions, repetitive actions and speaking, sitting/standing for extended periods of time, frequent bending/twisting, and ability to lift, push, and pull up to 50 lbs
  • Understanding the concept of mandatory safety at heights – previous climbing experience an asset
  • Experience working as a ropes course or zipline attendant with high/low elements considered an asset
  • Experience facilitating groups of all ages and diverse backgrounds
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong customer focus providing friendly, professional, and efficient service
  • Effective problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • Demonstrate high levels of positive energy and a willingness to take on new challenges
  • Meet and set a strong example for Pursuit grooming standards
  • Strong communication and listening skills with local and international guests and staff, second language skills highly advantageous
  • First Aid Training an asset

What will your work environment be like?

  • Beautiful. You’ll work in an iconic, unforgettable and inspiring location. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events – and fun! 
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around national parks
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi 
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together – these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole. 

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Golden, British Columbia, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.

Logistics at full potential.

At GXO, we're constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you'll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

1st Shift, Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm

We're seeking an Operations Supervisor who can bring out the best in his/her team. If you know how to encourage people to continually raise the bar while taking responsibility for all day-to-day warehouse operations, you might be an ideal fit for our growing company. As a member of our team, you'll have the committed support to excel at your job and the resources to build an exciting career.

Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.

What you'll do on a typical day:

  • Ensure efficient daily operations of the warehouse
  • Prepare schedules
  • Supervise the team and provide training and coaching to improve performance
  • Monitor work quality to consistently deliver exceptional customer service
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the company quality policy
  • Adhere to the GXO 7S program
  • Maintain a clean environment at all times
  • Communicate well with leadership, team members and other departments
  • Implement continuous improvement action plans
What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you'll need:

  • 2 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) and computerized scanner equipment
  • Availability to work a flexible schedule as needed, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends
It'd be great if you also have:
  • Bachelor's degree in Logistics or a related field
  • 2 years of managerial or supervisory experience
  • Bilingual English/Spanish
  • Experience in an AS9100 or ISO environment
  • Warehousing or Third-Party Logistics (3PL) experience
This job requires the ability to:
  • Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights
  • Stand, sit or walk for extended periods of time
  • Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel
  • Handle or manage tools or equipment
  • Tolerate hot or cold warehouse environments

Our greatest strength is our global team - energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

title: Supervisor, Operations (Afternoon Shift)
description:
Operations Supervisor


You will be responsible for organizing and directing the activities of production employees in the aerospace/defence manufacturing industry, under the guidance of the Manager, Operations in a unionized environment.


Location: Mississauga, ON


Your Challenge:


+ Ensure all direct reports work according to the Quality Management System (QMS), company safety policy, and OHSA requirements.

+ Supervise team members across multiple functional workgroups on 2 nd shift (4 x 10 hour, 3:00 pm -- 1:30 am, Monday to Thursday).

+ Assign and manage all shop work assignments and activities.

+ Direct and listen to employees in a manner that will promote good employee relations and produce a well-motivated and productive workforce.

+ Conduct regular communication and safety meetings within departments.

+ Provide career development for department staff in a team-oriented atmosphere.

+ Actively engage in continuous improvement program by identifying and championing improvements to work processes methods, equipment, fixtures, and tooling.

+ Provide input to the Manager for the preparation of departmental budgets.

+ Monitor all hours worked, track attendance and balance overtime of direct reports.

+ Ensure all trade qualifications are up-to-date and records maintained.

+ Willing and able to work overtime and occasional Saturdays.

+ Take every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of direct reports


Your Expertise:


+ Minimum 5 years related experience in a production environment.

+ A sound knowledge of occupational health and safety, plus a willingness to achieve "competence" as a supervisor as per the Ontario OHSA.

+ Experience in a lean manufacturing environment and willing to participate in continuous improvement program, training and mentorship.

+ A strong technical background in machining, hydraulics, mechanical assembly, electrical/electronic controls plus hands on experience in the operation of these types of equipment is highly desired.

+ Excellent leadership skills and supervisory experience

+ Strong oral and written communications skills

+ Strong computer skills (MS Office, Word, Excel and Powerpoint)


All employees must be eligible to meet the requirements for the Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and/or a Canadian Government security clearance.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact ta_coe@curtisswright.com and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

title: Operations Supervisor
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

We’re looking for an Operations Supervisor to oversee two of our commercial properties in Downtown Ottawa! This role is responsible for ensuring that our buildings are well presented and operated according to the highest possible standards. To be successful, vision should not only be focused on the day-to-day operations of the property but also the long-term potential of the property. This role is counted on to establish and maintain strong relationships with tenants, staff, and contractors. It also assists with the implementation of new programs and ensure policies and procedures are followed.
 

RESPONSIBILITIES
 

Operations Management

  • Manage property repair and maintenance operations, including but not limited to building mechanical, electrical and life safety systems.
  • Responsible and accountable for the staff’s daily activities, which includes the repair, maintenance and replacement of the building’s major components and related systems.
  • Oversee the operations of the building automation systems to ensure maximum energy efficiency and occupant comfort.
  • Develop, administer and follow-up on preventive maintenance programs for all equipment and the building in general (Angus Preventative Maintenance).
  • Ensure life safety and risk management programs are implemented and kept current.
  • Perform routine inspections of buildings ensuring the Property Manager is kept updated on any discrepancies and the remedy
  • Document and arrange for appropriate remedial work using the company purchasing/procurement guidelines
  • Oversee and monitor customer service levels provided and implements continuous service improvements
  • Ensures organizational adherence and accountability to standard operating procedures
  • Oversee all health and safety requirements
  • Ensure all applicable code and/or regulatory testing and inspections are done on time and documented
  • Oversee site security team and administration of the security system
 

Reporting + Budgeting

  • Review and update both technical and operations manuals including Fire Plan, Emergency Management Plan, Disaster Plan, Construction Rules and Regulations, Asbestos Management Plan, Energy Management Plan
  • Log daily and provide monthly reports on base building operations to the Property Manager in a prompt fashion.
  • Establish building service contracts specifications, prepare tenders based on the policies and procedures established, make recommendations, obtain approval, and follow up on execution and performance.
  • Oversee preparation and ongoing administration of capital project administration, documents, contracts and related functions

 

Relationship Building

  • Monitor, mentor, coach and develop direct reports, ensure adherence to policies and procedures, provide recognition; evaluate and provide feedback on performance, address performance concerns and resolve problems
  • Lead their team in providing the highest levels of service to all customers with whom they interact, whether internal or external, with the goal of continuously improving the customer experience
  • Liaise with tenants regularly to ensure complete tenant satisfaction and ensure that tenant concerns are promptly addressed.
  • Oversee tenant improvement work and obtain proposals and pricing for work

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be able to attain and maintain a Secret Level clearance
  • 6+ years of commercial industry experience at multiple properties, including people leadership experience
  • Post-secondary education in Engineering, Building Sciences, BOMI Designations (SMA/SMT) and/or Trades training (BES Class 1 and 2)
  • Solid contract management and computer skills (Outlook, Excel, Word, Office 365, YARDI, ANGUS, Cority and some shared database exposure)
  • Knowledge of LEED and BOMA standards, and an environmental focus
  • Excellent people leadership abilities and a dedication to continuous improvement
  • Approachable, positive demeanor with a hands-on and team-oriented work style
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to quickly understand and identify issues and propose solutions
  • Takes initiative, is proactive in their work, and results-oriented
  • Ability to manage and adapt to change
  • Must be a resourceful team player, with a strong commitment to customer service and the ability to effectively balance numerous priorities. Able to adapt to shifting priorities
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to communicate proficiently in the English language (verbal and written)
  • Bilingualism (French) an asset but not a requirement

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

Job Description and Responsibilities

 

EVRAZ North America has an opening for a Operations Supervisor at our Recycling facility in Regina, Wheat City Metals. This role is responsible for directing the day-to-day operations of a scrap metal recycling yard, including the supervision of employees engaged in the daily intake, processing and shipment of ferrous scrap metals.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Direct the activities of all yard staff to include training, scheduling, assigning tasks, and performance management

  • Supervise equipment operators, maintenance personnel, torch cutters, scrap inspectors and non-ferrous staff

  • Maximize freight utilization by ensuring trucks and railcars are loaded to capacity

  • Establish and maintain comprehensive safety programs and procedures, facilitate safety meetings to discuss yard issues and best practices, organize required safety training, conduct daily safety observations and enter data into Enablon

  • Recognize opportunities to improve equipment, people and processes; submit appropriate improvement suggestions for management approval with sufficient detail to justify cost

  • Ensure compliance with all Environmental, Safety, Health and other Company policies, procedures and requirements

  • Ensuring product quality to minimize downgrades

  • Submit vacation requests for approval and ensures employee hours from timecards are recorded for payroll purposes

  • Create production metrics to achieve optimal operational efficiency

 

Requirements

  • High School Diploma or equivalent

  • 3 to 5 years xperience in a unionized manufacturing/industrial environment, preferably in metal scrap recycling or steel production

  • Valid driver’s license is required

  • Knowledge of Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations and safety standards

  • Strong ability to motivate staff and effectively accomplish tasks through others

  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products and possess the ability to learn in-house computer systems

  • Knowledge and awareness of construction and industrial sites

  • Willing to wear required protective equipment

  • Must be willing to work varied shifts and start times, including weekends

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Job Description and Responsibilities

EVRAZ NA is seeking a Night Shift Operations Supervisor for our Navajo Recycling Facility in Calgary, Alberta. The Operations Supervisor supports the General Manager to coordinate all aspects of site operations including but not limited to; sales, production, purchasing, customer service and managing a team. The Operations Supervisor will also ensure that the site remains safe and environmentally compliant, while effectively and efficiently working within the guidelines of the administrative policies and procedures of the company.

  • Manage/direct the selection, training, development, appraisal and work assignments of exempt and non-exempt professionals (Mangers/Supervisors) and non-exempt hourly employee
  • Partners with the Environmental, Health and Safety Team to ensure that the site is adhering to all safety and environmental policies and procedures. Promotes a clean, safe, and environmentally compliant site for employees and customer
  • Manages, trains, and develops all employees
  • Responsible for staffing scheduling and managing the day-to-date operations of the site
  • Drive site performance by optimizing sales, production, and product purchasing
  • Manage financials by understanding and taking corrective actions in response to monthly financial statements and operating key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Establish community relationships to promote and enhance the site brand
  • Follows company policy and procedures and leads by example for the rest of the employees
  • Ensure policies and procedures are communicated and implemented at the site level
  • Prepares operating reports for the management and operations team
  • Ensure that all sales transactions and cash management procedures are in compliance with company policy
  • Responsible for the overall safeguarding of company assets
  • Partner with all internal corporate support resources to ensure compliance with all laws and regulations to achieve results
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements

  • Minimum of 3 years’ management or leadership experience in industrial manufacturing, automotive or distribution environments
  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Solid quantitative skills to understand site financial performance and operating statistics (KPIs)
  • Must have the ability to reconcile sales, prepare reports and read technical manuals
  • Able to handle multiple priorities while performing quality work in an efficient manner with minimal supervision
  • Able to work required hours which includes weekends and holidays and also at any site assigned within reasonable distance from home site
  • Loader and heavy equipment operator license preferred but not required
  • Manual dexterity to handle tools and the ability to move 50 pounds
  • Must have strong interpersonal skills
  • Willing and able to work in variable weather conditions including hot, dry summer conditions and cold, harsh winter conditions

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Job Posting #: PIC-TG-004-2021

Posting Date: June 10, 2021

Position: Dealer 1 (Part-Time)

Department: Table Games

Location: Pickering Casino Resort

Shifts: Shift bids/picks will be awarded based on seniority, skills & abilities assessment, and acceptable file review.

Pickering Casino Resort is seeking Table Games Dealer 1!

Don’t miss the opportunity to join One Toronto Gaming’s new Pickering Casino Resort Table Games team!

This exciting career opportunity at the new Pickering Casino Resort is seeking dynamic individuals with a drive to succeed, strong guest relations and supervisory skills; responsibilities of this role will align with the position of Table Games Dealers upon opening of Pickering Casino Resort.

Upon opening and under the general direction of Table Games Supervisor, this position is responsible for providing superior customer service and conducting all table games in a precise, efficient and secure manner according to policies and procedures. Above all else, management must lead by example to create Great Experiences and Memories for all guests and colleagues!

The ideal candidate is an energetic professional with proven knowledge, skills and abilities, executing the following in support of the company’s vision, mission and values: 

  • Performs opening and closing procedures for table games;
  • Deals table games in accordance with department standards and all regulations
  • Follows procedures to maintain security of table assets during play
  • Takes control of the table, including dealing out disruptive and/or disrespectful players;
  • Complies with all government regulations, Internal Controls and Department & Company policies and procedures;
  • Communicates with Supervisor on table issues, including but not limited to responsible gaming, alcoholic beverage consumption concerns, violations of table rules and/or other issues
  • Promotes Responsible Gaming;
  • Ensures accurate chips handling and game commentaries are made in an audible and precise manner;
  • Demonstrate strong customer service skills and behaviours, delivering exceptional experiences to internal and external guests;
  • Develops and cultivates strong working relationships with all stakeholders including guests, ownership, employees, vendors and regulators;
  • Responds to, resolves or escalates issues and inquiries concerning table games;
  • Reports irregularities and suspicious activities to supervisor immediately;
  • Ensures compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations.

Successful applicants will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • High school diploma required; post-secondary education an asset;
  • Experience in a related field of one (1) or more years or a combination of equivalent working experience in a highly customer service-oriented role or entertainment-type setting;
  • Knowledge of all aspects of gaming policies and procedures and game protection would be an asset;
  • Strong organizational, attention to detail, interpersonal, analytical and communication skills;
  • Proven ability to follow strict policies, procedures and practices;
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time;
  • Math skills (balancing, addition and calculation) and manual dexterity (shuffling, riffling). An assessment for both skills will be administered.
  • Dealer Training will be provided for candidates who are successful through the screening, interview and assessment phase
  • Ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario.

Pickering Casino Resort candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights. The hours of work will be based on operational needs. Ready to embark on your next adventure?
